intro: Scutellaria rubropunctata var. naseana, commonly known as the red-spotted skullcap, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It features upright, branching stems that bear opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces showy, two-lipped flowers that are typically blue to violet in color, with prominent red spots on the lower lip. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and valuable species within the Scrophulariaceae family.
